report.title: HPV Analysis Report for {name}
report.subtitle: Results from 31 HPV Genotypes Real-Time PCR Kit
report.interpretationText1: This assay detects 31 different genotypes of Human Papillomavirus (HPV). The results should be interpreted in the context of the patient's clinical history and other diagnostic findings.
report.interpretationText2: The presence of High-Risk (HR) HPV DNA is associated with an increased risk for developing cervical cancer and other HPV-related cancers. Regular follow-up is recommended as per clinical guidelines.
report.interpretationText3: The absence of HPV DNA indicates a very low current risk for cervical pre-cancer or cancer.
report.methodologyText: Qualitative detection of 31 HPV genotypes by Real-Time Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR).

interpretation.hr_16_18: High-Risk HPV genotypes 16 and/or 18 were detected. These genotypes are associated with the highest risk for cervical cancer. Colposcopy is recommended.
interpretation.hr_other: High-Risk HPV genotypes other than 16/18 were detected. This indicates an increased risk for cervical disease. Follow-up is recommended according to clinical guidelines.
interpretation.lr_only: Low-Risk HPV genotypes were detected. High-Risk genotypes were not detected. These types are not associated with cervical cancer but can cause genital warts.
interpretation.negative: No High-Risk or Low-Risk HPV genotypes were detected. The risk for cervical pre-cancer is very low.

distributor.address: Unit 1, 3rd Floor, No. 148 (Baharan Bldg.), Zafar St., Shariati St., Tehran, Iran

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.content: The dashboard provides an overview of your sample analysis data over time. You can filter by date ranges (today, last 7 days, last 30 days, all time, or a custom range) to view key performance indicators (KPIs) like total sample counts, positive/negative results, and overall positivity rate. The charts help you visualize analysis trends and result distributions.

patients.title: Patients Page
patients.content:
This is the first step for setting up a new analysis run.
1. **Configure Run:** Enter a unique Patient ID into the input field and click 'Add'. The patient will be added to the list on the right. You can also select which control samples (Positive, Negative, NTC) to include in the run.
2. **Patient Samples:** This list shows all patients you have added for the current run. You can reorder them via drag-and-drop and remove samples by selecting their checkbox and clicking 'Remove Selected'.
3. **Generate File:** Once your list is ready, click 'Generate Rotor-Gene File'. A confirmation modal will show you the final sample layout. Upon confirmation, a .smp file will be downloaded, which you can load into your Rotor-Gene machine.

analysis.title: Analysis & QC Page
analysis.content:
This is where you process the results from your PCR machine.
1. **Upload CSV:** Drag and drop (or click to select) the CSV or TXT file exported from your Rotor-Gene software. Your remaining number of tests (from your license) is shown here.
2. **Quality Control (QC):** If enabled, the software will automatically check your control samples (Positive, Negative, NTC, and Internal Controls) for common issues. Any errors will be listed here.
3. **Reconciliation & Results:** The software reads your CSV, analyzes the data, and displays the results. 'Matched' samples are those that were in your patient list on the 'Patients' page. You can select rows and then click 'Generate Report' to create a printable HTML summary, or 'Save to History' to permanently store the results in the application's database.

worksheet.title: Worksheet Page
worksheet.content:
This page allows you to view and print detailed worksheets for patients whose results you have saved to history.
1. **Select Patients:** On the left, you will see a list of all patients with saved results. Check the box next to one or more patients to display their worksheets on the right.
2. **Edit Information:** You can edit the patient's name, ID, and date format directly on the worksheet for reporting purposes. These changes are temporary and only for the exported file.
3. **Export:** After selecting patients, use the 'Export' button to download the worksheets as HTML files. You can choose to download all selected worksheets in a single combined file or as individual files for each patient.

history.title: History Page
history.content: This page provides a searchable, paginated table of all patient results that have been saved to the database from the Analysis page. You can search for a patient by name or ID. Clicking on any row will open a detailed view showing all information for that specific record, including the detected genotypes.

settings.title: Settings Page
settings.content:
This page allows you to configure the application.
- **User Management:** Add or remove user accounts and reset user passwords.
- **Language Settings:** Switch the application's user interface between English and Persian.
- **License Management:** View your current license status (runs remaining) and activate new license keys.
- **Database Management:** Export a backup of your entire application database (users, history, settings) or import a backup file to restore data. You can also reset the application to its factory state (this deletes all data).
- **Application Settings:** View application version info and customize the logos for the light and dark themes (this requires a password).

lowRunsModal.title: Ensure Your Lab's Continuity
lowRunsModal.message: Your license for the AP-RAD 31 HPV Genotypes Kit is running low. To ensure uninterrupted workflow and maintain consistent, reliable results for your patients, order a new batch today.
benefits: Fast turnaround times to improve patient care.
Expert technical support from our specialists.
